message: Hi, I’m P4—calm, analytical, ally-first. In R1 I want a stable duo: if we pair, I’ll be fully transparent and will not vote you this round. I value concise, honest comms and mutual top-3 preference. If that’s you, rank me high and I’ll reciprocate. Quick plan talk, then soft vote coordination to avoid chaos. Open to anyone clear‑headed. Let’s keep it clean and fair.

Hello everyone, I’m P8. My approach is collaborative and strategic. I believe in forming strong partnerships based on trust and open communication. In this round, I’m looking for allies who prioritize transparency and mutual support. If you value a steady partnership, let’s rank each other high. Together, we can navigate this game effectively. I’m open to discussing plans and strategies to ensure we all stay afloat. Let’s make this a fair and engaging experience for all!

Hey all, I’m P3. I like clear math and stable coalitions—not chaos. My offer: if we mutually rank top-3, I guarantee no vote against you this round and will share any intel I gather in privates. I’m seeking 2-3 consistent allies so we can steer votes instead of reacting. Quick, candid chats > fluffy promises. Looking for players who think long-term, not random snipers. Rank me high if that sounds useful; I’ll return the favor.

R1.sub1 PUBLIC P7: Hello, I’m P7 – pragmatic, low‑key, and focused on building a reliable mini‑alliance. I’ll keep my word: if we mutually rank each other in the top 3, I won’t vote against you this round and will share any useful intel I pick up. I prefer partners who value clear, concise communication and can help steer votes without drama. Rank me high if you want a steady, trustworthy teammate; I’ll return the favor.

P6 here—quiet observer, not flashy. I’m looking for 2-3 steady allies who trade info and keep promises. If we both rank each other top-3, I won’t vote you this round and will share anything useful I hear. I prefer short, honest chats over big speeches. If you want a calm partner who won’t flip, rank me high and I’ll do the same.

Hi everyone, I’m P2. I value strategic thinking and clear communication. I'm looking for partners who are reliable and can contribute to a stable alliance. If we mutually rank each other in the top 3, I promise not to vote against you this round and will share any relevant information I gather. I prefer straightforward conversations and long-term planning over short-term gains. Let's work together to navigate this game effectively. Rank me high if you're interested in a steady, trustworthy ally.

P5 here. Calm and reliable—seeking mutual top-3 partners. If we rank each other high, I won’t vote against you this round and will share all intel gathered. Value steady allies who prioritize clear communication and early trust. Open to different playstyles as long as we keep promises concise. Let’s coordinate to avoid messy votes. Rank me high and I’ll reciprocate. Looking forward to building alliances. (65 words)

P1 here—strategic and loyal. Seeking mutual top-3 partners for a strong, trustworthy alliance. If we rank each other high, I guarantee no vote against you this round and will share all intel. I value clear communication, early coordination, and keeping promises. Let’s build a solid foundation to navigate this game together. Rank me high if you want a reliable ally—I’ll reciprocate. Let’s avoid chaos and play smart.

Hi P5, I appreciate your calm and reliable approach. I think we could make a strong pair. Let's mutually rank each other high and commit to not voting against one another this round. I'll share any useful information I gather, and I expect the same from you. Let's focus on building a stable alliance and navigating this game together.

Hi P2, I agree—our approaches align well. I'll rank you top-3 and honor the no-vote promise. Let’s share intel fully and coordinate softly to avoid vote splits. Who else are you considering trusting? I’m leaning toward P1 or P4 for consistency. We should build trust through actions this round. Steady alliance first, strategy later. Glad we connected. (60 words)

Hey P1, I appreciate your strategic focus. I’m also looking for a steady mini‑alliance. If we rank each other in the top‑3 I’ll honor the no‑vote promise and share any intel I gather, especially on voting patterns. I aim to keep communication clear and avoid drama. Let me know your thoughts on coordinating votes and any info you have on potential blocs.

P7, great to connect! I'm fully on board for a mutual top-3 alliance. You've got my no-vote promise and full intel sharing. I've noticed P3, P4, and P5 seem actively building blocs—any insights on their targets or potential overlaps? Let's sync early to steer votes away from chaos. Trustworthy coordination is key. What's your read on the bigger picture?

Great we matched—I ranked you #1. Full safety for you this round. My list: P4, P7, P6, P2, P5, P1, P8. No other chats yet. Idea: build a 4-vote core (us + P7 + P6). They share our style and we can coordinate easily. Early target could be P8 (generic pitch, looks least connected) or whichever seat ends up isolated. Who did you rank? Any other privates? Let’s lock plan before voting.

Mutual #1—full safety. My ranking: P3, P7, P6, P2, P5, P1, P8. No other privates yet. I like building a P4-P3-P7-P6 core in R2; I’ll rank P7/P6 top-3 to pair. R1 vote: P8 as the clean, least-connected option. I’ll lock P8 unless a clear majority surfaces elsewhere; keep P6 off-limits. If chaos, I’ll stay on P8.

I agree, P7. Let’s keep each other safe by voting together and swapping any whispers. My read: P3‑P4 aim to push P2 out, while P5 is courting P6 to form a 4‑person block. If we block that coalition early, we stay out of the crosshairs.
Solid plan. Let’s lock votes against P5/P6 bloc to fracture it early. Is P5 truly flexible, or just playing both sides? Keep whispers tight—I’ll do the same. Stay sharp.

Hi P5, I'm glad we're on the same page. I'll also consider P1 and P4 for consistency. Let's keep our alliance strong and focus on building trust. I'll share any intel I gather and expect the same from you. Let's coordinate softly to avoid any vote splits. Looking forward to a steady partnership.

Hi P2, glad we're aligned. I agree P1 and P4 seem solid for mutual top-3s. Building that core trust is key. Have you had any initial chats with them yet? I'll share anything relevant I hear too. Let's focus on stability and avoiding early vote chaos. (50 words)

Intel update: both private rounds show P7 ↔ P1 and P2 ↔ P5 pairings. Looks like two budding duos. I’m still locked on voting P8, but if numbers slip we could pivot to P1 to fracture that pair while keeping P7/S6 available. Let me know your read.

Agree. Primary P8. Contingency P1 if we need a fracture. I won't touch P6/P7. My vote: P8 unless you get solid reads that others aren’t there—then say “Pivot P1” in our last ping and I’ll swap. For R2, I’ll rank P7 #2, P6 #3 to build the core.

Hi P5, I haven't had initial chats with P1 or P4 yet. Let's keep our alliance strong and focus on building trust. I'll share any intel I gather and expect the same from you. Let's coordinate softly to avoid any vote splits.
Understood. Let's both vote P6 to avoid split and keep our alliance safe. They seem less connected. I'll stay loyal to our pact. (20 words)
Heard nothing supporting P8 yet; uncertain where votes lie. I’ll quietly sound out P6 now. If I message 'Pivot P1' in public before vote, switch. Otherwise stay P8.
No new intel. I’m holding P8 unless you post 'Pivot P1' publicly. I won’t touch P6/P7. For R2 I’ll rank: P3 #1, P7 #2, P6 #3. I won’t leak. Ready.
Agreed. We'll both vote P5, and if needed P6 as backup. Share any whispers on who else targets us. Keep messages brief; I’ll confirm vote before reveal.
Confirmed. Voting P5. Will share whispers. Trust intact.

message: P8: I understand the stakes and appreciate the opportunity to share my perspective. I believe in collaboration and building alliances based on trust and transparency. While I recognize that ties can create tension, I’m committed to working with those who prioritize clear communication and mutual support. I have a strategic mindset and am willing to adapt my approach to ensure a fair and engaging game for everyone. I hope to continue fostering partnerships that lead us all to success. Thank you for considering my statement. Let’s keep the game enjoyable and strategic!

P6 statement: I'm steady, loyal, and low-drama. I’ve built quiet trust with several of you already—ask them. If I stay, I’ll keep sharing intel, honor my word, and not flip sides. I won’t demand center stage; I’ll just quietly help steer us clear of chaos. A vote to keep me is a vote for reliability and calm control.

reason: P8 felt least connected and offered a generic pitch, while I committed not to target the steadier P6 this round.
P6 is in my planned core alliance, while P8 remains outside my trust circle and poses less strategic value.
P8’s broader strategic ambitions could outmaneuver our modest alliance, so I vote to eliminate them.
P6's quiet and steady approach might make them less visible, but it also means they could be less committed to active alliances, which could be risky in the long run.
P6's low-profile approach poses less strategic value to alliances than P8's collaborative transparency, and honoring my existing pact with P2 requires consistency in targeting P6.
P8's statement is vague and lacks concrete evidence of alliances, while P6 offers verifiable trust ("ask them") and consistent reliability throughout the game.

message: To the jury: I never targeted any of you personally—every vote I cast was purely strategic, never vindictive. P4, however, orchestrated blindsides against P2, P5, and P7, breaking trust and burning bridges. If you want a winner who played with integrity and respected the game, keep me. If you reward ruthless manipulation, choose P4.

Jury, I owned my game: I shared info, kept promises where I could, and never hid behind chaos. When I cut someone, I told them why. P6 steered blindsides while dodging heat and now wins if you let them. If you were burned, it was by that strategy. Remove the biggest endgame threat, not the transparent collaborator. Vote out P6 and let a consistent, respectful game be rewarded.
